# openapi-java-client

Browshot API
- API version: 1.17.0
  - Build date: 2024-10-12T12:00:44.909980-04:00[America/New_York]
  - Generator version: 7.9.0

Take screenshots of any website in real time

  For more information, please visit [https://browshot.com/contact](https://browshot.com/contact)

*Automatically generated by the [OpenAPI Generator](https://openapi-generator.tech)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.8+
2. Maven (3.8.3+)/Gradle (7.2+)

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>org.openapitools</groupId>
  <artifactId>openapi-java-client</artifactId>
  <version>1.17.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
  repositories {
    mavenCentral()     // Needed if the 'openapi-java-client' jar has been published to maven central.
    mavenLocal()       // Needed if the 'openapi-java-client' jar has been published to the local maven repo.
  }

  dependencies {
     implementation "org.openapitools:openapi-java-client:1.17.0"
  }
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/openapi-java-client-1.17.0.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java

// Import classes:
import org.openapitools.client.ApiClient;
import org.openapitools.client.ApiException;
import org.openapitools.client.Configuration;
import org.openapitools.client.auth.*;
import org.openapitools.client.model.*;
import org.openapitools.client.api.AccountApi;

public class Example {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    ApiClient defaultClient = Configuration.getDefaultApiClient();
    defaultClient.setBasePath("https://api.browshot.com/api/v1");
    
    // Configure API key authorization: apiKeyQuery
    ApiKeyAuth apiKeyQuery = (ApiKeyAuth) defaultClient.getAuthentication("apiKeyQuery");
    apiKeyQuery.setApiKey("YOUR API KEY");
    // Uncomment the following line to set a prefix for the API key, e.g. "Token" (defaults to null)
    //apiKeyQuery.setApiKeyPrefix("Token");

    AccountApi apiInstance = new AccountApi(defaultClient);
    Integer details = 1; // Integer | level of information returned
    try {
      Account result = apiInstance.getAccountInfo(details);
      System.out.println(result);
    } catch (ApiException e) {
      System.err.println("Exception when calling AccountApi#getAccountInfo");
      System.err.println("Status code: " + e.getCode());
      System.err.println("Reason: " + e.getResponseBody());
      System.err.println("Response headers: " + e.getResponseHeaders());
      e.printStackTrace();
    }
  }
}

```

## Documentation for API Endpoints

All URIs are relative to *https://api.browshot.com/api/v1*

Class | Method | HTTP request | Description
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------------
*AccountApi* | [**getAccountInfo**](docs/AccountApi.md#getAccountInfo) | **GET** /account/info | Get information about your account
*BatchApi* | [**createBatch**](docs/BatchApi.md#createBatch) | **POST** /batch/ceate | Requests thousands of screenshtos at once
*BatchApi* | [**getBatchInfo**](docs/BatchApi.md#getBatchInfo) | **GET** /batch/info | Get the batch status
*BrowserApi* | [**getBrowserInfo**](docs/BrowserApi.md#getBrowserInfo) | **GET** /browser/info | Get information about a browser
*BrowserApi* | [**getBrowsersInfo**](docs/BrowserApi.md#getBrowsersInfo) | **GET** /browser/list | Get all browsers
*InstanceApi* | [**getInstanceInfo**](docs/InstanceApi.md#getInstanceInfo) | **GET** /instance/info | Get information about an instance
*InstanceApi* | [**getInstancesInfo**](docs/InstanceApi.md#getInstancesInfo) | **GET** /instance/list | Get all instances
*ScreenshotApi* | [**createMultipleScreenshots**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#createMultipleScreenshots) | **GET** /screenshot/multiple | Request multiple screenshots
*ScreenshotApi* | [**createScreenshot**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#createScreenshot) | **GET** /screenshot/create | Request a screenshot
*ScreenshotApi* | [**deleteScreenshot**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#deleteScreenshot) | **GET** /screenshot/delete | Delete screenshot data
*ScreenshotApi* | [**getHTML**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#getHTML) | **GET** /screenshot/html | Get the HTML code
*ScreenshotApi* | [**getMultipleScreenshotsInfo**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#getMultipleScreenshotsInfo) | **GET** /screenshot/list | Get information about screenshots
*ScreenshotApi* | [**getScreenshotInfo**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#getScreenshotInfo) | **GET** /screenshot/info | Query screenshot status
*ScreenshotApi* | [**getThumbnail**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#getThumbnail) | **GET** /screenshot/thumbnail | Retrieve a thumbnail image
*ScreenshotApi* | [**hostScreenshot**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#hostScreenshot) | **GET** /screenshot/host | Host thumbnails on your own S3 account or on Browshot.
*ScreenshotApi* | [**searchScreenshot**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#searchScreenshot) | **GET** /screenshot/search | Search for screenshots
*ScreenshotApi* | [**shareScreenshot**](docs/ScreenshotApi.md#shareScreenshot) | **GET** /screenshot/share | Share a screenshot

## Documentation for Authorization


Authentication schemes defined for the API:
<a id="apiKeyQuery"></a>
### apiKeyQuery

- **Type**: API key
- **API key parameter name**: key
- **Location**: URL query string


## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
